title: [Self-Directed] Development of an Educational Impact Assessment Framework: A Computational, Problem-Solving, and Graph Analysis-Centered Program for Strengthening Elementary Mathematics Teaching Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics pedagogy knowledge, understanding of core mathematical concepts (equations, statistics, probability), and graph interpretation skills
context.additional_context: Strengthens elementary school teachers' capacity to develop evaluation systems for measuring mathematics education effectiveness. Particularly emphasizes designing assessment tools for specific mathematical competencies: students' calculation skills, problem-solving processes (variable analysis), and graph interpretation. Stresses evidence-based approaches for achieving educational objectives.

learning_goals: Acquire the ability to design three or more scientific evaluation metrics (e.g., computational accuracy, problem-solving time, graph interpretation skills) to measure educational program effectiveness.

Develop application plans for assessment frameworks tailored to educational levels (elementary school/lifelong learning) and analyze the utilization of formulas and statistical models (e.g., equations, statistical models).

Execute two or more data collection methods for learning outcome analysis (e.g., eye-tracking, digital problem-solving log analysis) and derive statistically based results (e.g., probability distributions, mean comparisons).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
